title: Release v0.14.0
Update dependencies to their latest versions
body:
This is specially relevant for users that try to combine `chrono-tz` v0.10.x with `rrule`, as otherwise several versions of `chrono-tz` can be pulled into a project, which is both inefficient (could cause two sets of timezone information to be embedded in the resulting binaries) and confusing (different `chrono-tz` versions have different versions of the same types, which makes it more cumbersome to interoperate with `rrule`).

MSRV was bumped to 1.81 because the latest version of `home`, a transitive build dependency pulled by `afl`, requires that Rust version.

title: Remove `lazy_static` dependency in favor of `std` `OnceLock`
body: The MSRV of this crate is higher than 1.70, which introduced `std::sync::OnceLock`, a type which can act as a similarly ergonomic replacement for the `lazy_static` and `once_cell` crates. Pulling the least dependencies is always welcome by users of a library such as `rrule`, so let's replace uses of `lazy_lock` with `OnceLock`.

title: Add missing test attribute to test function
body: The `respect_utc_timezone_in_exdates_rdates` test function was defined alongside other tests, but lacking a `#[test]` attribute, causing it to not be executed as a test and to produce unused code warnings. The test itself runs well and I can see no reason to keep it ignored, so let's add the `#[test]` attribute to it as it was likely intended.

title: Fix some new Clippy lints
body: As stated in the PR title, these changes address some lints reported by Clippy.

title: Prepare v0.13 release
Drop alias Datetime; use chrono::Datetime
body:
This is mostly in preparation for https://github.com/fmeringdal/rust-rrule/issues/24

A lot of these functions will continue taking a `DateTime<Tz>` as parameter, but other will allow a generic `Timezone` as parameter.

title: fix(rruleset): respect timezone when serializing `EXDATE` and `RDATE`
body: As for now, `EXDATE` and `RDATE` are printed with `Z` postfix even if they have local timezone

title: bump dependencies and remove use of deprecated types
body:
Bump dependencies chrono-tz and serde_with. Also remove use of deprecated chrono types and functions to decrease the number of compile time warnings.

Edit: added missing feature "derive" to serde.

title: RRuleSetIter: removed lifetimes and added from_str example
fix: render weekdays as valid rrule strings
body: Previously, weekdays would've been rendered by their built-in name (e.g. `Sun`)

title: Bump version to 0.12.0
Fix RRuleSet FromStr implementation to add exrules as exrules and not as rrules
Bump MSRV to 1.74
Fix invalid occurrences for BYDAY rrules
body: Fixes #104. When incrementing a monthly RRULE, the end of month check breaks recurrences if the new counter date falls outside of the month's date range. Instead of using `increment_yearly`, just update the `year` to avoid the call to `fix_day`.

title: Add `RRuleSet::set_from_string` to support loading rules without DTSTART
body:
This PR adds a new method to RRuleSet called `set_from_string` which is similar to the `FromStr` implementation but allows passing rules without a DTSTART line. This is useful in particular when working with Google's API, which provides the rrule without the DTSTART:

![image](https://github.com/fmeringdal/rust-rrule/assets/39950/567b47ba-d97f-42ae-8b92-9a051d490216)

As it stands today, because the entire parser module is private, you would need to format a DTSTART line and add it to the rrule (only for it to be parsed again).

I pulled out the common logic in `from_str` to a private `set_from_content_lines` method to avoid duplication.

title: Fix clippy lints
Making ParseError and ValidationError public
Fix display impl for RRuleSet
Capitalize FREQ value in string representation
Update chrono-tz and some other packages and some cleanup
Change the return type of `RRuleSet::all` to a struct
body:
Fix #80 
@fmeringdal is “limited” a correct wording? I still don't know its use case :)
Isn't “truncated” better?

Fix #64
I didn't test it, but don't forget to add your API token as `CARGO_REGISTRY_TOKEN` in the repo Settings > Secrets > Actions

title: Introduce new RRuleTimezone that wraps chrono_tz::Tz
Remove errors during iteration
body:
This PR changes the signature of `RRuleSet::all` and `RRuleSet::all_unchecked` to not return a `Result` and always return dates. This is possible by changing two things in the code:
1.  Assume  that reaching a validation limit is not an error. If a limit is reached that stops the iteration, it will be signaled back to the user by also returning a boolean in the `RRuleSet` method.
2. Overflowing the `counter_date`, i.e. going past year 262000 will stop the iteration and make a warning log and not consider this an error.
